# Introduction 

```{r}
#' visCOS global options
#' 
#' Get and set the global options of visCOS
#' 
#' These are the options you can adapt by executing the function 
#' (default values)
#' \preformatted{
#'   viscos_options(
#'     name_data1 = "qobs",
#'     name_data2 = "qsim"
#'     name_COSyear = "yyyy",
#'     name_COSmonth = "mm",
#'     name_COSday = "dd",
#'     name_COShour = "hh",
#'     name_COSmin = "min",
#'     name_COSposix = "posixdate",
#'     name_COSperiod = "period",
#'     # plot stuff
#'     color_data1 = "steelblue", 
#'     color_data2 = "palevioletred",
#'     plot_title = "title",
#'     legend_title = "legend",
#'     xlab = "year",
#'     clr1 = '#FF3300',
#'     clr2 = '#f6f3a1',
#'     clr3 = '#005900',
#'     clr4 = "purple4",
#'     midpoint = 0.5,
#'     limits = c(0,1),
#'     lb_cut = 0.0,
#'     text_size = 0.5)}
#'
#' @export



viscos_options <- GlobalOptions::setGlobalOptions( 
  name_data1 = "qobs", 
  name_data2 = "qsim", 
  name_COSyear = "yyyy",
  name_COSmonth = "mm",
  name_COSday = "dd",
  name_COShour = "hh",
  name_COSmin = "min",
  name_COSposix = "posixdate",
  name_COSperiod = "period",
  # plot stuff
  color_data1 = "steelblue", 
  color_data2 = "palevioletred",
  plot_title = "title",
  legend_title = "legend",
  xlab = "year",
  clr1 = '#FF3300',
  clr2 = '#f6f3a1',
  clr3 = '#005900',
  clr4 = "purple4",
  midpoint = 0.5,
  limits = c(0,1),
  lb_cut = 0.0,
  text_size = 0.5
)

```
